summary: Heya Doc! How do you think Izuku's mom and Mirio's dad would parent their children?
question: Heya Doc! How do you think Izuku's mom and Mirio's dad would parent their children?
answer:
Oh this is interesting! For those who dont know atm I’m a psychology major with an emphasis on school psychology and family studies. Probably no surprise that I gravitate towards writings about family and children XD. I hope you enjoy this!

Order up!

Izuku Midoriya

🥦 Inko is a very sweet woman, and an equally sweet mom. But oh man. This woman establishes the rules and expects her son to follow them with no question, and will lay down some boundaries without complaint. She is a single mom after all and she knew if she was gonna do this herself she could not be a pushover.

🥦"Izuku Midoriya! Where do you think you’re going young man!“

🥦switches from touch disciplinarian, to babying in seconds. Cause in the end of the day she loves her little Izuku, and he is the most precious thing to ever come into her life. She never wants him to feel unloved at all.

🥦When she learned Izuku was quirkless she had trouble adjusting. Her child had an obvious disadvantage in this super powered world and for once she didnt know what to do. So she spent days just patrolling quirkless children forums and reading article after article of advice. She was just afraid. So Inko tried to give her son as much of an upper hand as possible. Feeding into his love of learning and trying to give him as much real world skills as possible so he too could contribute to society even without a quirk. Though he has one now she still thinks a lot of those skills have come in handy.

🥦As Izuku got older she let loose on the boundaries and the two of them kind of became a team. Though her son constantly gave her heart attacks she began to treat him less like a child, and more like the adult she slowly can see him as. He wont be her baby forever, and as much as it scares her she needs to let her baby fly out of the nest.

With a side of!

Mirio Togata!

🥐Togata dads parenting can be described in one word. Coddling. He is just not the disciplinary type, and the most he had ever done with his son was ground him for a day. Yeah, terrible, he knows! But he just cant help himself when his little sunshine looks at him with those eyes.

🥐He for the life of him can not let go. He just wants Mirio to remain his little boy forever and forever and it takes the counseling of many friends that it isnt right for him to do that. Mirio was 18, an adult. An adult who didnt even know how to cook his own meals, and do his own laundry. It was time to stop the coddling.

🥐Mirio is a great guy! Dont get me wrong! But he is a bit spoiled. Not always understanding what others may feel (it’s not ok to flash random underclassman) and only thinking about himself. He doesnt mean it to be rude though and always apologizes if he offended someone.

🥐None of this means Mirios dad is a terrible father though. We arent all perfect after all. Togata dad always pushed Mirio to work harder at everything! Never letting him quit once he starts and always motivating him to go the extra mile. Support can go a long way in a child’s life.

🥐Poor Togata dad though would cry when he becomes an empty nester. Calling his son everyday until he finally is comfortable enough to let him live an adult life. It just a big adjustment for everyone after all, and when Mirio is thriving then his dad is just as happy.

title: Bakugou Katsuki x Reader *Explicit*
body:
A cheerful ping in the other room drew my attention up from the task of brushing my back molars. Cocking my head to one side, I studied the reflection in the mirror for a brief moment and considered ignoring it until I was done with all my nighttime rituals. It was probably just one of my friends sending a stupid meme or something. Certainly nothing that couldn’t wait.

But curiosity won out in the end and, still lackadaisically scrubbing the toothbrush across my teeth, I turned to walk into my bedroom. Stepping around the bed, I snatched my phone off the sheets where I’d left it. My brows shot up when I saw it was a message from my boyfriend and I quickly read the text, blood instantly pounding in my ears.

I got my license today.

I read it again. Then again.

Letting out a closed mouth squeal around my toothbrush, I unlocked the screen with anxious fingers. I was already typing before the device even had enough time to catch up and I had to delete the garbled mess of autocorrected words it generated so I could start over. Excitement thrummed through my body when I finally hit the send button.

Yes!! I knew you could do it! Good job!

The dots indicating that Bakugou was typing sprang into existence almost immediately. Feeling giddy and light, I distractedly shuffled back into the attached bathroom so I could spit out the toothpaste in my mouth. I was so proud of him and I hoped he was able to give himself the credit he deserved for this milestone. Failing the first exam had been a hard pill to swallow after all, but he’d worked harder than anyone else to correct those mistakes.

I don’t know what I would’ve done if that half-and-half bastard passed and I didn’t. I’m glad to be done with it!

I slowed to a stop in front of the sink as I read Bakugou’s reply and smiled to myself. His perceived rivalry with that Todoroki boy would be the end of him, I was sure of it. But this wasn’t the time to chide him about such things and, leaving the toothbrush poking out of the corner of my mouth, I took the phone with both hands so I could type a little quicker.

Well, you got your license and that’s all that matters! I think a celebration is in order! Wanna’ come over? ; )
